questions.question_body: Which document determines the conditions and procedures for using the radio frequency spectrum by amateur radio service in Bulgaria?
questions.A: Regulation N1 of 1996 of the Committee on Posts and Telecommunications
questions.B: Decision ITU/IARU/317 of the International Telecommunication Union (ITU)
questions.C: The Amateur Radio Handbook
questions.D: The Rules for the use of radio frequency spectrum for radio equipment from amateur radio service (the Rules)

questions.question_body: Who determines the conditions and procedures for using the radio frequency spectrum by amateur radio service?
questions.C: Bulgarian Federation of Radio Amateurs

questions.question_body: Which of the possible answers contains entirely elements from the Rules?
questions.A: Conditions for using the radio frequency spectrum, including technical parameters for operating radio equipment from amateur radio service, as well as requirements for persons who use it
questions.B: Permit for amateur radio competence, logbook for radio contacts, types of antennas
questions.C: Call sign, confirmation of conducted radio contacts, emission classes of amateur radio stations

questions.question_body: Which of the following questions is NOT subject to the Rules?
questions.B: Requirements related to the technical means used
questions.C: Permitted antennas for conducting electronic communication radio amateur activity

questions.question_body: For what three reasons does amateur radio exist?
questions.A: To improve and perfect communications, to improve the technical skills of dedicated persons, to help provide electronic communications in disasters and emergencies
questions.B: To train in business communications, to facilitate communication between officials, to help make expedient business decisions
questions.C: To preserve old amateur radio equipment, to maintain a sufficiently wide circle of people familiar with tube and transistor equipment, to improve tubes and transistors
questions.D: To reduce the use of mobile phones and internet, to communicate with hard-to-reach places and to preserve the use of Morse code

questions.question_body: What are two of the purposes of amateur radio activity?
questions.A: To preserve historical radio information, to help society learn the history of radio
questions.B: To help state authorities improve electronic communications, to help improve technical skills
questions.C: To modernize amateur radio circuits, to increase the number of people familiar with amateur radio circuits
questions.D: To increase the number of experienced radio operators, to satisfy the needs for personal contacts between radio amateurs around the world

questions.question_body: Who has the right to impose penalties for violations of the Rules?
questions.C: Bulgarian Federation of Radio Amateurs

questions.question_body: What is the definition of a radio amateur?
questions.A: A person who has no professional experience operating radio stations
questions.B: A person who has been issued a permit for competence as a radio amateur or harmonized amateur radio examination certificate (HAREC)
questions.C: A person who is interested in radio broadcasts from distant radio stations
questions.D: A person who is in the process of training to operate radio stations

questions.question_body: What is the definition of amateur radio contacts?
questions.A: Radio contacts established between amateur radio stations
questions.B: Radio contacts established between competent persons
questions.C: Radio contacts established between natural persons
questions.D: Radio contacts intended for initial training of radio amateurs

questions.question_body: What is the definition of an amateur radio station?
questions.A: A radio station that can be moved and operate from points with different geographical locations or in motion
questions.B: A radio broadcasting station with a small territorial range
questions.C: Radio communication equipment consisting of one or more radio transmitting or radio receiving devices or a combination thereof, including antenna-feeder systems and auxiliary devices, and can be used for electronic communications in at least one of the bands provided for use by radio amateurs
questions.D: A radio station used for initial training of new professional operators

questions.question_body: What are the amateur radio classes in the Republic of Bulgaria?
questions.A: Class A, class B, class C, class D
questions.C: Harmonized amateur radio certificate A, B, C, and D

questions.question_body: What is the amateur radio class with which beginner radio amateurs start their activity?
questions.C: Class 2

questions.question_body: Who can obtain an amateur radio class in the Republic of Bulgaria?
questions.A: Anyone except employees of the Ministry of Defense and the Ministry of Interior
questions.C: Anyone
questions.D: Anyone who has completed courses for the respective amateur radio class

questions.question_body: At what age can one obtain amateur radio class 2?
questions.C: After reaching 18 years of age

questions.question_body: For what period of time is the amateur radio class valid?
questions.C: 10 years

questions.question_body: Which radio amateur has the right to a CEPT license?
questions.A: A radio amateur holding a call sign and permit for competence as a radio amateur class 1
questions.B: The holder of a personal listener sign
questions.C: A member of a club amateur radio station
questions.D: Any radio amateur holding a permit for competence

questions.question_body: Who has the right to use an amateur repeater owned by a private individual?
questions.B: All radio amateurs holding a call sign, written permission from the owner and complying with the conditions of the Rules
questions.C: All radio amateurs holding a call sign, complying with the conditions of the Rules
questions.D: It is not allowed for private individuals to build amateur repeaters

questions.question_body: Can a person who is not a radio amateur operate from a club amateur radio station in Bulgaria?
questions.A: Only if they are a member of the respective radio club
questions.B: Only in the presence of the station manager
questions.C: Only in the presence of the station manager and under the supervision of a class 1 radio amateur

questions.question_body: From where does a Bulgarian radio amateur have the right to operate on amateur frequencies?
questions.B: Where local laws and regulations allow it
questions.C: Within a radius of no more than 50 km from their permanent address

questions.question_body: If you hold amateur radio class 2, with how many radio transmitters do you have the right to operate?
questions.B: Only one except in emergency circumstances, disasters and accidents
questions.C: Any number
questions.D: Any number, but provided they transmit on different bands

questions.question_body: Can a class 2 radio amateur become the manager of a club amateur radio station?
questions.B: Can, if the radio station transmits in the bands 144-146 MHz and/or 430-440 MHz
questions.C: Can, if they have reached 18 years of age

questions.question_body: What emission class is a class 2 radio amateur entitled to in the 144-146 MHz band?
questions.C: Class J3E

questions.question_body: What emission class is a class 2 radio amateur entitled to in the 430-440 MHz band?
questions.C: Class A2A

questions.question_body: What transmitter power should a class 2 radio amateur use?
questions.A: Not more than 100 W, permissible only when communicating with very distant correspondents
questions.B: Not more than 25 W, regardless of distance to correspondent
questions.C: Not more than 10 W, and within populated areas - not more than 5 W
questions.D: The minimum power necessary for stable communication, but not more than 5 W

questions.question_body: With which of the indicated transmitter powers does a class 2 radio amateur have the right to transmit on frequency 145.500 MHz?
questions.C: From 5 to 50 W

questions.question_body: If you hold class 2, on which of the frequencies do you have the right to transmit?
What should the radio amateur do if they lose their permit for competence?
questions.A: It is not necessary to take action in this case
questions.B: Submit an application to the Communications Regulation Commission for reissue of the document and pay the respective fee
questions.C: Take the respective exam again
questions.D: Submit an application to the District Police Department, accompanied by an explanatory note about the circumstances under which the original was lost

questions.question_body: What are the boundaries of the 144 MHz amateur radio band?
If you are transmitting on frequency 145.450 MHz, in which amateur radio band are you?
questions.C: 10-meter

questions.question_body: If another radio amateur holding a call sign operates your personal amateur radio station, who is responsible for complying with radio contact procedures?
questions.C: Both
questions.D: The other radio amateur has the right to operate only from a club, but not from a personal radio station

questions.question_body: If you are a radio amateur holding a call sign and you operate from a foreign amateur radio station, who is responsible for complying with radio contact procedures?
questions.A: The owner of the radio station
questions.C: Both
questions.D: The manager of the radio club, because under the specified conditions radio contacts are possible only from a club radio station

questions.question_body: What obligations do you have as the owner of a personal amateur radio station to allow another radio amateur to use it?
questions.A: To require the radio amateur to present their permit for radio amateur competence
questions.B: To require the radio amateur to present a document with their assigned call sign
questions.C: To require the radio amateur to present permission from the Communications Regulation Commission
questions.D: You do not have the right to make your radio station available for use by another radio amateur

questions.question_body: If you allow another radio amateur with a higher amateur radio class than yours to operate from your radio station, what rights does he have?
questions.A: Only the rights arising from your amateur radio class
questions.B: All rights that his amateur radio class allows
questions.C: Emission class and maximum power permitted for his amateur radio class, but only in frequency bands permitted for your amateur radio class
questions.D: Frequency bands permitted for his amateur radio class, but only in emission class and maximum power permitted for your amateur radio class

questions.question_body: Under what conditions can members of your family use your personal amateur radio station?
questions.A: After receiving written consent from you
questions.B: After obtaining a permit for radio amateur competence and being provided with a call sign
questions.C: Only in your presence
questions.D: After obtaining a personal listener sign

questions.question_body: Which of the following is NOT allowed to be discussed in an amateur radio contact?
questions.C: Personal address and phone

questions.question_body: How often must a radio amateur transmit their call sign during a radio contact?
questions.A: At the start of the radio contact and then every ten minutes
questions.C: At the start and end of the radio contact

questions.question_body: What do you transmit as identification of the amateur radio station?
questions.A: Your short name by which you are known among radio amateurs
questions.B: Your last name and call sign
questions.C: The call sign

questions.question_body: What identification is necessary (if at all necessary) when two radio amateurs start a radio contact?
questions.B: One radio amateur must transmit the correspondent's call sign, the other must transmit his call sign
questions.C: Each of the radio amateurs must transmit the correspondent's call sign and his own call sign
questions.D: Identification is necessary only when making radio contact with a foreign radio amateur

questions.question_body: Under what condition do you have the right to conduct a radio contact with a foreign radio amateur?
questions.A: Only if you use the English language
questions.B: Only if it is indicated in your permit for radio amateur competence
questions.C: Only with radio amateurs from countries with which Bulgaria has signed an agreement

questions.question_body: When are radio amateurs allowed to broadcast radio programs from an amateur radio station?
questions.B: Only in emergency circumstances, disasters and accidents
questions.C: Only with permission from the Communications Regulation Commission
questions.D: If using power up to 50 mW and the program is heard only within a radius of 500 m

questions.question_body: When are radio amateurs allowed to broadcast music from an amateur radio station?
questions.A: There is no prohibition against broadcasting music from an amateur radio station
questions.B: Only if it is necessary to jam an illegitimately transmitting radio station
questions.C: Never
questions.D: Only if using power up to 50 mW and the radio contact is not through an amateur repeater

questions.question_body: When can radio amateurs transmit encrypted messages?
questions.A: Only during an amateur radio contest
questions.C: Only when making radio contact with a non-amateur radio station
questions.D: When the radio contact is through an amateur repeater and it is necessary that the message text not be understood by other radio amateurs

questions.question_body: When do you have the right to deliberately interfere with the operation of another amateur radio station?
questions.A: Only if you determine that the respective radio amateur is not transmitting their call sign
questions.C: Only if the station starts transmitting on the frequency you are using
questions.D: Only when the other station deliberately interferes with your transmission

questions.question_body: When do you have the right to transmit with a shortened call sign?
questions.C: When working with Bulgarian radio amateurs
questions.D: When working with a very well-known radio amateur

questions.question_body: When is it permissible to use an invalid call sign?
questions.B: When you want to keep the content of the transmitted text secret
questions.C: When you want to play a harmless joke on a very well-known radio amateur
questions.D: Only in emergency circumstances, disasters and accidents

questions.question_body: When a radio amateur transmits the signal (word) MAYDAY in a normal situation, how is his action classified?
questions.A: Traditional amateur radio greeting on the occasion of May Day
questions.C: Transmission of a false distress signal
questions.D: Nothing special. MAYDAY does not have the meaning of a distress signal

questions.question_body: If you respond to a radio amateur without transmitting your call sign, what action have you performed?
questions.A: Test transmission to check the equipment
questions.C: Transmission to check if the signal reaches the correspondent
questions.D: It is prohibited by the conditions of the Rules to conceal one's own call sign

questions.question_body: Which of the following activities is prohibited?
questions.A: Transmission of facts and information that constitute amateur radio secret
questions.C: Transmission of text with indecent and offensive content

questions.question_body: Which of the following activities is prohibited?
questions.A: Simultaneous use of two radio transmitters on two amateur radio bands
questions.B: Restricting the use of an amateur radio repeater
questions.C: Transmission from an amateur radio station of a bulletin with amateur radio news

questions.question_body: With which non-amateur radio stations do radio amateurs have the right to establish normal radio contact?
questions.A: With any, but only within the boundaries of amateur radio bands
questions.B: Only with services outside the system of the Ministry of Defense and the Ministry of Interior
questions.C: With any, but only on a secondary basis without creating interference to primary services

questions.question_body: Which of the following is a Bulgarian amateur radio call sign?
questions.C: LZA6W

questions.question_body: Which numbers are normally used to form the call signs of Bulgarian amateur radio stations and repeaters?
questions.C: From 0 to 9

questions.question_body: If LZ1AA operates from the radio station of LZ1BB, what call sign should he use?
questions.C: LZ1AA / LZ1BB

questions.question_body: If LZ1AA with permanent address in Sofia operates with his personal radio station from his cottage in Nessebar, what call sign should he use?
questions.C: LZ1AA / 1

questions.question_body: If a class 2 radio amateur hears in the 144-146 MHz band a radio station with call sign LZ75HAM, what behavior should he have towards it?
questions.A: The station is amateur, has the right to operate on this band and the radio amateur can call it for a radio contact
questions.B: The station is of aeronautical mobile service, has the right to operate on this band, but not with amateur stations, so the radio amateur should not call it
questions.C: The station is of aeronautical mobile service, does not have the right to operate on this band, so the radio amateur can establish radio contact with it and ask it to leave the band
questions.D: The station is amateur, but from its call sign it follows that only class 1 radio amateurs can establish radio contacts with it

questions.question_body: What call sign is LZ0AAA?
questions.C: Of a DX expedition

questions.question_body: Which of the following is a personal listener sign?
questions.C: LZ317

questions.question_body: What call sign is LZ/DL6AA?
questions.A: Of a Bulgarian radio amateur transmitting from another country
questions.B: Of a foreign radio amateur transmitting from Bulgaria
questions.C: Of a Bulgarian radio amateur seeking contact with another country
questions.D: Of a foreign radio amateur seeking contact with Bulgaria

questions.question_body: What call sign is LZ1AW/M?
questions.A: Of a radio amateur operating from a maritime vessel
questions.B: Of a radio amateur operating from a land vehicle
questions.C: Of a radio amateur operating with a portable radio station
questions.D: Such a call sign is invalid and its use is improper

questions.question_body: When must a radio amateur transmit after their call sign under a slash the letter "P" or the word "portable"?
questions.A: When using a factory-produced radio station
questions.B: When using a personally constructed radio station
questions.C: When using a portable radio station
questions.D: When using a low-power radio station

questions.question_body: What is the permissible band of modulating audio frequencies in an amateur radio contact?
What is the maximum permissible bandwidth of emission in the bands allowed for operation by class 2 radio amateurs?
questions.C: 2.7 kHz

questions.question_body: What is the maximum permissible frequency deviation in the bands allowed for operation by class 2 radio amateurs?
questions.C: Depending on the technical purpose of the transmitter

questions.question_body: What is the maximum permissible power of spurious emissions of the radio transmitter of a personal amateur radio station of a class 2 radio amateur?
questions.C: 50 milliwatts

questions.question_body: Is it permissible for a VHF antenna of an amateur radio station or the cable connecting it to pass over overhead high-voltage and telecommunication lines?
questions.C: It is not permissible only over telecommunication lines
questions.D: It is not permissible only over high-voltage lines

questions.question_body: What should be the minimum distance inside a building between an amateur radio antenna system (including the antenna line) and an existing electronic communication installation?
questions.A: No restrictions if the lines are shielded and operation without mutual interference is guaranteed
questions.B: The minimum distance should be 2 m
questions.C: The minimum distance should be 5 m
questions.D: The minimum distance is according to the power used and is described in the Technical Requirements

questions.question_body: Which of the listed connections of ground conductors is not permissible?
questions.C: Connection to neighboring amateur radio antenna

questions.question_body: When do you have the right to conduct radio contacts and use your call sign on the air?
questions.A: From the date of successfully passed exam for amateur radio class 2
questions.B: 5 working days after the date on which you successfully passed the exam for amateur radio class 2
questions.C: After issued permit for competence as a radio amateur and letter for provision of personal call sign
questions.D: From the date on which an application in the prescribed form has been duly filed, indicating the desired call sign

questions.question_body: Who has the right to revoke permits for competence as a radio amateur?
questions.C: Bulgarian Federation of Radio Amateurs

questions.question_body: Who has the right to revoke provided call signs?
questions.C: Bulgarian Federation of Radio Amateurs

questions.question_body: In which case is the issued permit for competence as a radio amateur revoked?
questions.A: For repeated violation of the Rules
questions.B: For established actions of the radio amateur that threaten national security
questions.C: When the radio frequency spectrum is not used for amateur radio purposes
